Topic.Title: the whole point of the new page is to integrate with Facebook

Message.Msg: I think its a bad move to integrate Yahoo, and Facebook. Only I should decide how I want my info shared, and to whom it should be shared with. Since companies are probably sharing personal info anyways without people knowledge, at the least they should let person know what info is used and for whom.

Topic.Title: Will Yahoo Keep Their Current Search Deal with Microsoft?

Message.Msg: Microsoft will work a new deal out with Yahoo if they are smart.

Topic.Title: the whole point of the new page is to integrate with Facebook

Message.Msg: you have the option not to participate with Facebook. you only share if you log in to yahoo with as a FB user with Facebook user name and password.

Topic.Title: is it possible 4 apple to partner with yahoo?

Message.Msg: Apple desperately needs Yahoo. Apple desperately needs to start partnering with sites like google and facebook too.... its iTune distribution system is a closed system. Horrible business strategy.

Message.Title: Economic Gloom- Abercrombie to close 50 stores
Message.Msg: Nothing in Yahoo "news" about it. Abercrombie and Fitch said it would close 40 to 50 stores in the US this year (2013) as the youth fashion retailer's shares tumbled follwing a weak sales in the crucial Christmas quarter. " Our Profitability is not where it needs to be," said Mike Jefferies, chief executive, on an earnings call with analysts, highlighting " a challenging US retail environment over the holiday period." "It is unknown how the customer will respond to the economic situation," said Oliver Chen, analyst at Citi Investment Research. "The impact of the increased payroll tax, elevated gas prices and continued macroeconomic uncertainty all led to weaker guidance." -Feb 23 2013 Financial Times

Topic.Title: Economic Gloom- Abercrombie to close 50 stores

Message.Msg: So what?

Message.Title: I hate trying to contact Yahoo this way, but they have no comment section for the home page
Message.Msg: anyone know where I can leave comments re: the new home page and news feeds? the new way that news is displayed on the home page is maddening! scrolling down to a news item on the home page is almost like that maddening thing that facebook does at the bottom of the page.....just as I'm finding a news item I'd like to read, the scroll expands and I lose the intended story in a sea of unrelated news items, then have to scroll back to try and find it the stories are not grouped in schools of related stories which makes it difficult to find what I'm interested in consequently, I'll need to get my news from one of the competative sites who groups their news listings by category rather than just puking them all over the desktop is someone knows where to post this constructive criticism, please direct me thanks
